intro: Senecio stokesii, commonly known as Stokes' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Stokes' groundsel is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
